meanings.sent1: I always bollix up my shoelaces when I try to tie them quickly.
meanings.sent2: Please don't bollix the instructions, just follow them step by step.
meanings.sent3: Trying to bollix the puzzle pieces together only made it harder to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a tangled web of thoughts, each one bollixing the next.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was so complex, it seemed to bollix the audience's minds.

meanings.sent1: The cords behind the TV were a bollix of wires and cables.
meanings.sent2: She tried to untangle the bollix of yarn, but it only got worse.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics turned the room into a bollix of overturned furniture.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam was a bollix of cars honking and trying to merge.
meanings.sent5: The garden hose was a knotted bollix that took ages to straighten out.

meanings.sent1: I accidentally bollixed the surprise by mentioning it too soon.
meanings.sent2: The rain threatened to bollix our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to cook dinner ended in a bollixed meal that no one wanted to eat.
meanings.sent4: The spilled ink bollixed the important document beyond recognition.
meanings.sent5: The last-minute changes bollixed the project timeline, causing delays.
